parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Form, outline, semblance. From morphoo; formation, i.e., appearance (concretely) formula).
Piety (towards God), godliness, devotion, godliness. From eusebes; piety; specially, the gospel scheme.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To turn away from, shun. From apo and the base of trope; to deflect, i.e. avoid.
